boat.name: Speedwell of Cremyll
boat.full_description: Speedwell of Cremyll was built as a 21st birthday present for a lucky young man! She took part in the 1970 Round Britain Race, and the concept of the Three Peaks Yacht Race was conceived in her saloon during a gale in Barra. She spent about 20 years in the Island Cruising Club fleet at Salcombe, and was later based in Oban for a lengthy period. She had a keel-off major refit at Gweek in 2018/19.
boat.construction_details: teak on rock elm, copper fastened, lead ballast keel
boat.short_description: Speedwell of Cremyll is a 49' Buchanan yawl, built in 1962
